member.summary: The connection class name to use.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.IDbProvider.UseParameterPrefixInSql
member.summary: Does this ConnectionProvider require the use of a Named Prefix in the SQL statement.
member.remarks:
The OLE DB/ODBC .NET Provider does not support named parameters for passing parameters to an SQL Statement or a stored procedure called by an IDbCommand when CommandType is set to Text.
For example, SqlClient requires select * from simple where simple_id = @simple_id If this is false, like with the OleDb or Obdc provider, then it is assumed that the ? can be a placeholder for the parameter in the SQL statement when CommandType is set to Text.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.IDbProvider.UseParameterPrefixInParameter
member.summary: Does this ConnectionProvider require the use of the Named Prefix when trying to reference the Parameter in the Command's Parameter collection.
member.remarks: This is really only useful when the UseParameterPrefixInSql = true. When this is true the code will look like IDbParameter param = cmd.Parameters["@paramName"], if this is false the code will be IDbParameter param = cmd.Parameters["paramName"] - ie - Oracle.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.IDbProvider.UsePositionalParameters
member.summary: The OLE DB/OBDC .NET Provider uses positional parameters that are marked with a question mark (?) instead of named parameters.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.IDbProvider.SetDbParameterSize
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports parameter size.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter size.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.IDbProvider.SetDbParameterPrecision
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports parameter precision.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter precision.

member.name: T:IBatisNet.Common.Utilities.ConfigWatcherHandler
member.summary: Class used to watch config files.
member.remarks: Uses the to monitor changes to a specified file. Because multiple change notifications may be raised when the file is modified, a timer is used to compress the notifications into a single event. The timer waits for time before delivering the event notification. If any further change notifications arrive while the timer is waiting it is reset and waits again for to elaps.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.AllowMARS
member.summary: Tell us if this provider allows having multiple open with the same .
member.remarks: It's a new feature in ADO.NET 2.0 and Sql Server 2005 that allows for multiple forward only read only result sets (MARS). Some databases have supported this functionality for a long time : Not Supported : DB2, MySql.Data, OLE DB provider [except Sql Server 2005 when using MDAC 9], SQLite, Obdc Supported : Sql Server 2005, Npgsql

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.DbConnectionClass
member.summary: The connection class name to use.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.UseParameterPrefixInSql
member.summary: Does this ConnectionProvider require the use of a Named Prefix in the SQL statement.
member.remarks:
The OLE DB/ODBC .NET Provider does not support named parameters for passing parameters to an SQL Statement or a stored procedure called by an IDbCommand when CommandType is set to Text.
For example, SqlClient requires select * from simple where simple_id = @simple_id If this is false, like with the OleDb or Obdc provider, then it is assumed that the ? can be a placeholder for the parameter in the SQL statement when CommandType is set to Text.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.UseParameterPrefixInParameter
member.summary: Does this ConnectionProvider require the use of the Named Prefix when trying to reference the Parameter in the Command's Parameter collection.
member.remarks: This is really only useful when the UseParameterPrefixInSql = true. When this is true the code will look like IDbParameter param = cmd.Parameters["@paramName"], if this is false the code will be IDbParameter param = cmd.Parameters["paramName"] - ie - Oracle.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.UsePositionalParameters
member.summary: The OLE DB/OBDC .NET Provider uses positional parameters that are marked with a question mark (?) instead of named parameters.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.SetDbParameterSize
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports parameter size.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter size.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.SetDbParameterPrecision
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports parameter precision.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter precision.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.DbProvider.SetDbParameterScale
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports a parameter scale.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter scale.

member.summary: Summary description for IPaginatedList.

member.name: M:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.NextPage
member.summary: Moves to the next page after the current page. If the current page is the last page, wrap to the first page.

member.name: M:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.PreviousPage
member.summary: Moves to the page before the current page. If the current page is the first page, wrap to the last page.

member.name: M:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.GotoPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves to a specified page. If the specified page is beyond the last page, wrap to the first page. If the specified page is before the first page, wrap to the last page.
member.param: The index of the specified page.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.PageSize
member.summary: The maximum number of items per page.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsFirstPage
member.summary: Is the current page the first page ? True if the current page is the first page or if only a single page exists.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsMiddlePage
member.summary: Is the current page a middle page (i.e. not first or last) ? Return True if the current page is not the first or last page, and more than one page exists (always returns false if only a single page exists).

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsLastPage
member.summary: Is the current page the last page ? Return True if the current page is the last page or if only a single page exists.

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsNextPageAvailable
member.summary: Is a page available after the current page ? Return True if the next page is available

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsPreviousPageAvailable
member.summary: Is a page available before the current page ? Return True if the previous page is available

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Pagination.IPaginatedList.PageIndex
member.summary: Returns the current page index, which is a zero based integer. All paginated list implementations should know what index they are on, even if they don't know the ultimate boundaries (min/max)

member.name: T:IBatisNet.Common.Transaction.TransactionScope
member.summary: Simple interface to COM+ transactions through Enterprise Service. Makes a code block transactional à la Indigo (evolution will be easier, it's the same API) It's important to make sure that each instance of this class gets Close()'d. Easiest way to do that is with the using statement in C#.
member.remarks:
Don't support nested transaction scope with different transaction options.
System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceDomain is available only on - XP SP2 (or higher) - Windows Server 2003 - XP SP1 + Hotfix 828741 and only in .Net 1.1. It CAN'T be used on Windows 2000.
http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx/kb/319177/EN-US/

member.name: P:IBatisNet.Common.Transaction.TransactionScope.Consistent
member.summary: Changes the vote to commit (true) or to abort (false). If all the TransactionScope instances involved in a transaction have voted to commit, then the entire thing is committed. If any TransactionScope instances involved in a transaction vote to abort, then the entire thing is aborted.
